title: How to Create, Delete, and Edit Your Status on WhatsApp

steps.title: Open WhatsApp Messenger.
steps.content: Open WhatsApp Messenger. The WhatsApp icon looks like a green box with a white speech balloon and a telephone in it. [1] X Research source While you can't edit an existing status, you can create a new one. Statuses will disappear after 24 hours, similar to Snapchat Stories . If you don't want to wait that long for a status to delete, you can manually delete it.

steps.title: Tap Updates.
steps.content: Tap Updates . This is at the bottom-left corner (iPhone) or at the top (Android). If WhatsApp opens up to a conversation, tap the back button in the upper-left corner.

steps.title: Tap +.
steps.content: Tap + . This is at the top of the screen.

steps.title: Create your Status.
steps.content: Create your Status. Tap the white circle at the bottom of your screen to take a picture, or hold it down to record video. To flip the camera, tap the two curved arrow icons in the bottom-right corner. You can also select a photo or video from your Camera Roll at the bottom-left of your screen to add it to your Status.

steps.title: Add to your Status.
steps.content: Add to your Status. Use WhatsApp's tools to add text, emoji, and drawings on your Status update. [2] X Research source Tap the Pencil icon in the upper-right corner to make colorful drawings on your Status update. Tap the T icon to add text. You can make your text any color or size, and you can move it around to put it anywhere. Tap the Sticker icon to add a sticker, emoji, or avatar. Tap the Crop button to adjust or crop the picture.

steps.title: Tap the Send button.
steps.content: Tap the Send button. It looks like a tiny paper plane in the lower-right corner of your screen. It will add this update to your Status. To delete a status, return to the Updates tab. Tap your status, and then tap the three-dots icon next to the status. Tap Delete .

steps.title: Tap Updates.
steps.content: Tap Updates . This is the tab at the bottom-left corner (iPhone) or at the top (Android). If WhatsApp opens up to a conversation, tap the back button in the upper-left corner.

steps.title: Tap the status.
steps.content: Tap the status. You'll see them listed from newest to oldest. You can see who viewed your Status here.

steps.title: Tap ••• .
steps.content: Tap ••• . This is next to the status.

steps.title: Tap Delete.
steps.content: Tap Delete . This is in the pop-up menu. The status will be deleted. If needed, you can change your privacy settings to limit who can see your Status on WhatsApp.
